q: The scariest moment is always just before you start. After that, things can only get better.
h:
“The scariest moment is always just before you start. After that, things can only get better.” —
Stephen King

q: Nothing in the world is ever completely wrong. Even a stopped clock is right twice a day.
h:
“Nothing in the world is ever completely wrong. Even a stopped clock is right twice a day.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: Just trust that everything is unfolding the way it is supposed to. Don't resist... Great things are waiting for you around the corner.
h:
“Just trust that everything is unfolding the way it is supposed to. Don't resist... Great things are waiting for you around the corner.” —
Sonia Ricotti

q: Don't talk about what you have done or what you are going to do.
h:
“Don't talk about what you have done or what you are going to do.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change their future by merely changing their attitude.
h:
“The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change their future by merely changing their attitude.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Words have no power to impress the mind without the exquisite horror of their reality.
h:
“Words have no power to impress the mind without the exquisite horror of their reality.” —
Edgar Allan Poe

q: Wealth is the product of man's capacity to think.
h:
“Wealth is the product of man's capacity to think.” —
Ayn Rand

q: If you are far from the enemy, make him believe you are near.
h:
“If you are far from the enemy, make him believe you are near.” —
Sun Tzu

q: You are now, and you do become, what you think about.
h:
“You are now, and you do become, what you think about.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Intense love does not measure, it just gives.
h:
“Intense love does not measure, it just gives.” —
Mother Teresa

q: The chief enemy of creativity is good sense.
h:
“The chief enemy of creativity is good sense.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: It's not the love you make. It's the love you give.
h:
“It's not the love you make. It's the love you give. ” —
Nikola Tesla

q: It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows.
h:
“It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows.” —
Epictetus

q: Even if our home burns down we can rebuild it. But the things that we got for nothing, we can never replace.
h:
“Even if our home burns down we can rebuild it. But the things that we got for nothing, we can never replace.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make one.
h:
“The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make one.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: With self-discipline, almost anything is possible.
h:
“With self-discipline, almost anything is possible.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Your dream has to be bigger than your fear.
h:
“Your dream has to be bigger than your fear.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Your success and happiness lie in you.
h:
“Your success and happiness lie in you.” —
Helen Keller

q: If you're waiting until you feel talented enough to make it, you'll never make it.
h:
“If you're waiting until you feel talented enough to make it, you'll never make it.” —
Criss Jami

q: Passion is energy. Feel the power that comes from focusing on what excites you.
h:
“Passion is energy. Feel the power that comes from focusing on what excites you. ” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: To live is to be willing to die over and over again.
h:
“To live is to be willing to die over and over again.” —
Pema Chodron

q: Change begets change. Nothing propagates so fast.
h:
“Change begets change. Nothing propagates so fast.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.
h:
“Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Fools read fast. Geniuses reread.
h:
“Fools read fast. Geniuses reread.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: The traveler sees what he sees. The tourist sees what he has come to see.
h:
“The traveler sees what he sees. The tourist sees what he has come to see.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: So long as we are being remembered, we remain alive.
h:
“So long as we are being remembered, we remain alive.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Turn off your mind, relax, and float downstream.
h:
“Turn off your mind, relax, and float downstream.” —
John Lennon

q: The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.
h:
“The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.” —
Bette Midler

q: Knowledge is learning something everyday. Wisdom is letting go of something everyday.
h:
“Knowledge is learning something everyday. Wisdom is letting go of something everyday.” —
Unknown

q: Decide what your truth is. Then live it.
h:
“Decide what your truth is. Then live it.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: When obstacles arise, you change your direction to reach your goal; you do not change your decision to get there.
h:
“When obstacles arise, you change your direction to reach your goal; you do not change your decision to get there.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Leadership is solving problems
h:
“Leadership is solving problems” —
Colin Powell

q: Do good by stealth, and blush to find it fame.
h:
“Do good by stealth, and blush to find it fame.” —
Alexander Pope

q: Life is about choice. You can choose to be a victim or anything else you like to be.
h:
“Life is about choice. You can choose to be a victim or anything else you like to be.” —
Celestine Chua

q: It's not whether you get knocked down, its whether you get back up.
h:
“It's not whether you get knocked down, its whether you get back up.” —
Vince Lombardi

q: Saying nothing sometimes says the most.
h:
“Saying nothing sometimes says the most.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: Words, once they are printed, have a life of their own.
h:
“Words, once they are printed, have a life of their own.” —
Carol Burnett

q: Everything you can imagine is real.
h:
“Everything you can imagine is real.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: Dream big. Start small. But most of all, start.
h:
“Dream big. Start small. But most of all, start.” —
Simon Sinek

q: Don't give up on your dreams, or your dreams will give up on you.
h:
“Don't give up on your dreams, or your dreams will give up on you.” —
John Wooden

q: Listen to what you know instead of what you fear.
h:
“Listen to what you know instead of what you fear.” —
Richard Bach

q: Against the assault of laughter nothing can stand.
h:
“Against the assault of laughter nothing can stand.” —
Mark Twain

q: It is ignorance that causes most mistakes.
h:
“It is ignorance that causes most mistakes.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: Before you embark on a journey of revenge, dig two graves.
h:
“Before you embark on a journey of revenge, dig two graves. ” —
Confucius

q: Life is really simple, but men insist on making it complicated.
h:
“Life is really simple, but men insist on making it complicated. ” —
Confucius

q: Intelligent people make many mistakes because they cannot believe the world is really as foolish as it is.
h:
“Intelligent people make many mistakes because they cannot believe the world is really as foolish as it is.” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: A man who cannot tolerate small misfortunes can never accomplish great things.
h:
“A man who cannot tolerate small misfortunes can never accomplish great things.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
h:
“The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.” —
Mark Twain

q: Unless someone truly has the power to say no, they never truly have the power to say yes.
h:
“Unless someone truly has the power to say no, they never truly have the power to say yes.” —
Dan Millman

q: Knowing is not enough, we must apply. Willing is not enough, we must do.
h:
“Knowing is not enough, we must apply. Willing is not enough, we must do. ” —
Bruce Lee
